tool.name: Hicup Truncater
tool.description: terminates sequence reads at specified Hi-C ligation junctions.
tool.command:
##Dealing with fastq and fastq.gz input1='$input_first_sequence' && input2='$input_second_sequence' && trunc_result_1=\$(echo '$input_first_sequence' | rev | cut -d'/' -f1 | rev) && trunc_result_2=\$(echo '$input_second_sequence' | rev | cut -d'/' -f1 | rev) &&
#if $input_first_sequence.is_of_type("fastq.gz", "fastqsanger.gz"): ln -s $input_first_sequence \$trunc_result_1.gz && input1=\$trunc_result_1.gz && #end if
#if $input_second_sequence.is_of_type("fastq.gz", "fastqsanger.gz"): ln -s $input_second_sequence \$trunc_result_2.gz && input2=\$trunc_result_2.gz && #end if
hicup_truncater --zip --re1 '$re1' $advanced_options.nofill #if $advanced_options.sequences: --sequences '$advanced_options.sequences' #end if \$input1 \$input2
&& mv \$trunc_result_1.trunc.fastq.gz dataset1.trunc.fastq.gz && mv \$trunc_result_2.trunc.fastq.gz dataset2.trunc.fastq.gz ## If the barchart have not been created #if $input_first_sequence.is_of_type("fastq.gz", "fastqsanger.gz"): && touch \$trunc_result_1.gz.truncation_barchart.svg #else && touch \$trunc_result_1.truncation_barchart.svg #end if
#if $input_second_sequence.is_of_type("fastq.gz", "fastqsanger.gz"): && touch \$trunc_result_2.gz.truncation_barchart.svg #else && touch \$trunc_result_2.truncation_barchart.svg #end if && mv \$trunc_result_1.*truncation_barchart.svg dataset1.truncation_barchart.svg && mv \$trunc_result_2.*truncation_barchart.svg dataset2.truncation_barchart.svg

param.label: Ligation sequence
param.help: Instead of specifying a restriction enzyme recognition sequence, specify the ligation sequences directly

tool.help:
For help please consult the documentation of HiCUP: http://www.bioinformatics.babraham.ac.uk/projects/hicup/overview/
To get more information about the truncater visit: http://www.bioinformatics.babraham.ac.uk/projects/hicup/scripts_description/#Truncater
